wikipedia_page.main: Charles John MacDonal Fox (5 December 1858 – 1 April 1901) was an English cricketer. He played 80 first-class matches for Kent and Surrey between 1876 and 1893.

response: *Charles Fox (1660–1713), British politician, Paymaster of the Forces
*Charles Fox (socialist activist) (1861–1939), British socialist activist and dentist
*Charles Fox (civil and railway engineer) (1810–1874), British civil and railway engineer, built the Crystal Palace
*Charles Foxe (died 1590), MP for Much Wenlock and Ludlow
